speaker: Unknown
text: Maybe you don't know us,

speaker: Unknown
text: This here is the son of Elder Drebber, and I'm Joseph Stangerson, who travelled with you in the desert when the Lord stretched out His hand and gathered you into the true fold.

speaker: His
text: As He will all the nations in His own good time,

speaker: His
text: He grindeth slowly but exceeding small.

speaker: his
text: We have come,

speaker: his
text: at the advice of our fathers to solicit the hand of your daughter for whichever of us may seem good to you and to her. As I have but four wives and Brother Drebber here has seven, it appears to me that my claim is the stronger one.

speaker: his
text: Nay, nay, Brother Stangerson,

speaker: his
text: the question is not how many wives we have, but how many we can keep. My father has now given over his mills to me, and I am the richer man.

speaker: his
text: But my prospects are better,

speaker: his
text: When the Lord removes my father, I shall have his tanning yard and his leather factory. Then I am your elder, and am higher in the Church.

speaker: his
text: It will be for the maiden to decide,

speaker: his
text: We will leave it all to her decision.

speaker: his
text: Look here,

speaker: his
text: when my daughter summons you, you can come, but until then I don't want to see your faces again.

speaker: Ferrier
text: There are two ways out of the room,

speaker: Ferrier
text: there is the door, and there is the window. Which do you care to use?

speaker: his
text: Let me know when you have settled which it is to be,

speaker: Stangerson
text: You shall smart for this!

speaker: Stangerson
text: You have defied the Prophet and the Council of Four. You shall rue it to the end of your days.

speaker: Stangerson
text: The hand of the Lord shall be heavy upon you,

speaker: Ferrier
text: He will arise and smite you!

speaker: Ferrier
text: Then I'll start the smiting,

speaker: his
text: The young canting rascals!

speaker: his
text: I would sooner see you in your grave, my girl, than the wife of either of them.

speaker: his
text: And so should I, father,

speaker: Unknown
text: but Jefferson will soon be here.

speaker: his
text: Yes. It will not be long before he comes. The sooner the better, for we do not know what their next move may be.

speaker: his
text: Twenty-nine days are given you for amendment, and then--

speaker: John Ferrier
text: Good God!

speaker: John Ferrier
text: How you scared me! Whatever made you come in like that.

speaker: John Ferrier
text: Give me food,

speaker: John Ferrier
text: I have had no time for bite or sup for eight-and-forty hours.

speaker: his
text: Does Lucy bear up well?

speaker: his
text: Yes. She does not know the danger,

speaker: John Ferrier
text: That is well. The house is watched on every side. That is why I crawled my way up to it. They may be darned sharp, but they're not quite sharp enough to catch a Washoe hunter.

speaker: Unknown
text: You're a man to be proud of,

speaker: Lucy
text: There are not many who would come to share our danger and our troubles.

speaker: his
text: You've hit it there, pard,

speaker: his
text: I have a respect for you, but if you were alone in this business I'd think twice before I put my head into such a hornet's nest. It's Lucy that brings me here, and before harm comes on her I guess there will be one less o' the Hope family in Utah.

speaker: her
text: What are we to do?

speaker: Lucy
text: To-morrow is your last day, and unless you act to-night you are lost. I have a mule and two horses waiting in the Eagle Ravine. How much money have you?

speaker: his
text: Two thousand dollars in gold, and five in notes.

speaker: Lucy
text: That will do. I have as much more to add to it. We must push for Carson City through the mountains. You had best wake Lucy. It is as well that the servants do not sleep in the house.

speaker: Jefferson Hope
text: We must make our start at once,

speaker: Ferrier
text: The front and back entrances are watched, but with caution we may get away through the side window and across the fields. Once on the road we are only two miles from the Ravine where the horses are waiting. By daybreak we should be half-way through the mountains.

speaker: Ferrier
text: What if we are stopped,

speaker: his
text: If they are too many for us we shall take two or three of them with us,

speaker: his
text: To-morrow at midnight,

speaker: his
text: When the Whip-poor-Will calls three times.

speaker: his
text: It is well,

speaker: his
text: Shall I tell Brother Drebber?

speaker: his
text: Pass it on to him, and from him to the others. Nine to seven!

speaker: his
text: Seven to five!

speaker: his
text: Hurry on! hurry on!

speaker: his
text: We are through the line of sentinels. Everything depends on speed. Hurry on!

speaker: him
text: Who goes there?

speaker: Jefferson Hope
text: Travellers for Nevada,

speaker: his
text: By whose permission?

speaker: Ferrier
text: The Holy Four,

speaker: his
text: Nine from seven,

speaker: Jefferson Hope
text: Seven from five,

speaker: his
text: Pass, and the Lord go with you,
